Posts.Content: On 8/14/2008 platinum wrote: I had back pain on one side and across my mid to lower back starting about half way through chemo, due, according to the doctors, to the pain that the combination of Taxol and Neulasta shots cause. It continues, in an abated, come and go way, ever since. I have done acupuncture and massage, but it still hangs on. Stretching and advil help. Drs say it is muscle pain, not a sign of cancer. Has anyone else had this lingering pain? I finished chemo in April. I have the same pain.  My started after treatment.  AIso, I had the same combination taxol and Neulasta.  I finished chemo the end of May.  I have the same lingering pain.   The last a couple of days it has been bad.  My Drs says the weather can cause more pain. Like on damp and raining days.  I stretch and keep myself active but it stills lingers.
Posts.Title: back pain during and after chemo

Posts.Content: HI, My back pain is gone.  The only time I experience any back pain is when I'm tired.  It took about a year to feel like myself.  I stretch alot  and keep myself busy.  I work, take care of my family,walk and take care of two puppies(that is crazy)but I love every minute.  So, I did not have any leg pain.  I did experience differ pain but that is better.  Like stiffness in my fingers and toes.  Sometimes, I get spasmings in my feet and lower legs(calf areas).  I do feel great and enjoy every minute of my life. I hope the pain gets better.  Try to exercise more that seem to help me.    take care of my family,walk and I have two puppies that keep me busy.
Posts.Title: back pain during and after chemo

Posts.Content: On 9/4/2008 cacann wrote:   On 9/1/2008 kah49 wrote: I have had stage 2 breast cancer, (small tumor but it had spread to lymph nodes), also her2 positive. i have finished chemo and radiation and am now 5 months into the herceptin treatments. I also had double mastectomy. I would like to hear from someone who has been diagnosed as being her2 positive, and has had the herceptin treatments. I guess i would just like to know that there is hope at the end of this journey. My dr says that my cure rate is at about 70 to 80 percent, but I read that sometimes the herceptin does not always work. Even though my cure rate is pretty high, I still get nervous, after reading some of the info on breast cancer. Maybe I should just quit reading so much, huh? ha ha Thank you for any info k I have been diagnosed with breast cancer stage 2 in December 2007.  I am also her2 positive.  I had about a third of my left breast removed and had a second surgery to remove the rest of the lymph nodes  in that area and under my arm as they found a small tumor on one of the lymph nodes under my arm after the first surgery.  I have been treated very agressively since January 2008 with 7 chemo treatments ( sceduled for 8, but could not tolerate the last one) and 34 radiation treatments.  I was given herceptin in smaller amounts during my regular chemo treatments.  Now, I go every three weeks for a two hour drip of herceptin along with a Femora chemo tablet daily.  However, I was told this herceptin can only be used by individuals that have a certain type of cancer and they have to be her2 positive.  I understand the herceptin actually targets and kills any of these tumor cancer cells in your body.   I have regular blood tests that will tell if I have this type of cancer cells in my body.  You might ask your doctor about that.  If you need it, I will find out the name of the test.  So far, so good!  I hear unbelievable survival stories at the cancer center I go to, even with stage four cancer.  I do know trying to keep a positve attitude is healing, but sometimes it is a struggle to keep positive.  Ten years ago, you and I might not have survived with this diagnosis.  Great strides have been made concerning breast cancer, and I am greatful and thankful to God.  I know I am going through this for a reason.  Hopefully, a really good reason.  Good luck to you and I hope this helps. A     I was dx with stage 2, lym nobe neg and her2 pos.  Also, treated aggressive with 8 chemo treatments.  I have herceptin every three weeks for one year.   What is the name of the blood test to detect the cancer cells?
Posts.Title: herceptin
